@ndrnour Actually finish() is just fine here, since the dialog hast 3 options,
-replace key
-upload with key
-cancel -> should cancel the uploading process, otherwise, it would have the same behavior as "upload with key"

Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters Suggested change Upload with Keys anyway Upload with Keys replaced The project contains bricks that access the web, and also seems to contain API keys. Please see our wiki why uploading these keys can be dangerous . Upload with this text anyway Upload with API keys replaced The project contains bricks that access the web, and also seems to contain API keys. Please see the wiki why uploading these keys can be dangerous. However, please change the format with the link in api_replacement_dialog_warning so that the html text with the URL is not included here verbatim, but instead is inserted at runtime, as a parameter, i.e., use something like %1 etc. Otherwise this can be destroyed by our translators, even inadvertently. We are not checking in all translations whether such links haven't been changed or somehow been corrupted.

Please see our wiki why uploading these keys can be dangerous + .

nodes.bodyText:
Please make this string also translatable.
Why the "e" at the end of secrete, instead of secret?

While reviewing, Julia and I talked about the translatable part, is it really convenient to translate that part? If the key is being replaced by a certain language(say Russian) and the person that downloads the project does not speak that specific language, they wouldn´t know what happened there and do not know what/that it should be replaced. While the English version would be understandable for most languages

While reviewing, Julia and I talked about the translatable part, is it really convenient to translate that part? If the key is being replaced by a certain language(say Russian) and the person that downloads the project does not speak that specific language, they wouldn´t know what happened there and do not know what/that it should be replaced. While the English version would be understandable for most languages

Three reasons:

Users primarily code for themselves.
Russian projects will anyway contain a lot of Russian, e.g., variable names, name of project, strings in parameters, etc.
We are already thinking of ways to include an optional in-app translate option allowing the user to see translations for all texts that might be in another language. This will include texts in strings in parameters.

By the way, to make it easier for our own translators, but also to facilitate point 3 above: Please change the inserted text to "insert API key here", i.e., without the all-caps and with dashes in between.
Ok that makes sense. I changed the inserted string to "insert API key here"!
Please choose a better name than "value".

This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    web, and also seems to contain API keys. Please see our <a href=%1s>wiki</a> why
          
          
            
                    web, and also seems to contain API keys. Please see %1s why
          
      
    
    
  

This shall be a clickable link, and the link shall be visible. It must be easy for translators.
